summary.long: Luke is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text: Forasmuch as many have taken in hand to draw up a narrative concerning those matters which have been fulfilled among us,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: even as they delivered them unto us, who from the beginning were eyewitnesses and ministers of the word,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: it seemed good to me also, having traced the course of all things accurately from the first, to write unto thee in order, most excellent Theophilus;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that thou mightest know the certainty concerning the things wherein thou wast instructed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There was in the days of Herod, king of Judaea, a certain priest named Zacharias, of the course of Abijah: and he had a wife of the daughters of Aaron, and her name was Elisabeth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they were both righteous before God, walking in all the commandments and ordinances of the Lord blameless.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they had no child, because that Elisabeth was barren, and they both were now well stricken in years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it came to pass, while he executed the priest’s office before God in the order of his course,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: according to the custom of the priest’s office, his lot was to enter into the temple of the Lord and burn incense.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the whole multitude of the people were praying without at the hour of incense.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there appeared unto him an angel of the Lord standing on the right side of the altar of incense.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Zacharias was troubled when he saw him, and fear fell upon him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the angel said unto him, Fear not, Zacharias: because thy supplication is heard, and thy wife Elisabeth shall bear thee a son, and thou shalt call his name John.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt have joy and gladness; and many shall rejoice at his birth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he shall be great in the sight of the Lord, and he shall drink no wine nor strong drink; and he shall be filled with the Holy Spirit, even from his mother’s womb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And many of the children of Israel shall he turn unto the Lord their God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he shall go before his face in the spirit and power of Elijah, to turn the hearts of the fathers to the children, and the disobedient to walk in the wisdom of the just; to make ready for the Lord a people prepared for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Zacharias said unto the angel, Whereby shall I know this? for I am an old man, and my wife well stricken in years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the angel answering said unto him, I am Gabriel, that stand in the presence of God; and I was sent to speak unto thee, and to bring thee these good tidings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, thou shalt be silent and not able to speak, until the day that these things shall come to pass, because thou believedst not my words, which shall be fulfilled in their season.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the people were waiting for Zacharias, and they marvelled while he tarried in the temple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he came out, he could not speak unto them: and they perceived that he had seen a vision in the temple: and he continued making signs unto them, and remained dumb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass, when the days of his ministration were fulfilled, he departed unto his house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after these days Elisabeth his wife conceived; and she hid herself five months, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus hath the Lord done unto me in the days wherein he looked upon me, to take away my reproach among men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now in the sixth month the angel Gabriel was sent from God unto a city of Galilee, named Nazareth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to a virgin betrothed to a man whose name was Joseph, of the house of David; and the virgin’s name was Mary.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he came in unto her, and said, Hail, thou that art highly favored, the Lord is with thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But she was greatly troubled at the saying, and cast in her mind what manner of salutation this might be.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the angel said unto her, Fear not, Mary: for thou hast found favor with God.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And behold, thou shalt conceive in thy womb, and bring forth a son, and shalt call his name Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shall be great, and shall be called the Son of the Most High: and the Lord God shall give unto him the throne of his father David:
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: and he shall reign over the house of Jacob for ever; and of his kingdom there shall be no end.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Mary said unto the angel, How shall this be, seeing I know not a man?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the angel answered and said unto her, The Holy Spirit shall come upon thee, and the power of the Most High shall overshadow thee: wherefore also the holy thing which is begotten shall be called the Son of God.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And behold, Elisabeth thy kinswoman, she also hath conceived a son in her old age; and this is the sixth month with her that was called barren.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For no word from God shall be void of power.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Mary said, Behold, the handmaid of the Lord; be it unto me according to thy word. And the angel departed from her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Mary arose in these days and went into the hill country with haste, into a city of Judah;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and entered into the house of Zacharias and saluted Elisabeth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass, when Elisabeth heard the salutation of Mary, the babe leaped in her womb; and Elisabeth was filled with the Holy Spirit;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and she lifted up her voice with a loud cry, and said, Blessed art thou among women, and blessed is the fruit of thy womb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And whence is this to me, that the mother of my Lord should come unto me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For behold, when the voice of thy salutation came into mine ears, the babe leaped in my womb for joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And blessed is she that believed; for there shall be a fulfilment of the things which have been spoken to her from the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And Mary said,
My soul doth magnify the Lord,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And my spirit hath rejoiced in God my Saviour.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For he hath looked upon the low estate of his handmaid:
For behold, from henceforth all generations shall call me blessed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For he that is mighty hath done to me great things;
And holy is his name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And his mercy is unto generations and generations
On them that fear him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He hath showed strength with his arm;
He hath scattered the proud in the imagination of their heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He hath put down princes from their thrones,
And hath exalted them of low degree.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The hungry he hath filled with good things;
And the rich he hath sent empty away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He hath given help to Israel his servant,
That he might remember mercy
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
(As he spake unto our fathers)
Toward Abraham and his seed for ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Mary abode with her about three months, and returned unto her house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Elisabeth’s time was fulfilled that she should be delivered; and she brought forth a son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And her neighbors and her kinsfolk heard that the Lord had magnified his mercy towards her; and they rejoiced with her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass on the eighth day, that they came to circumcise the child; and they would have called him Zacharias, after the name of his father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And his mother answered and said, Not so; but he shall be called John.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said unto her, There is none of thy kindred that is called by this name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they made signs to his father, what he would have him called.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he asked for a writing tablet, and wrote, saying, His name is John. And they marvelled all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And his mouth was opened immediately, and his tongue loosed, and he spake, blessing God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And fear came on all that dwelt round about them: and all these sayings were noised abroad throughout all the hill country of Judaea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all that heard them laid them up in their heart, saying, What then shall this child be? For the hand of the Lord was with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And his father Zacharias was filled with the Holy Spirit, and prophesied, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed be the Lord, the God of Israel;
For he hath visited and wrought redemption for his people,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And hath raised up a horn of salvation for us
In the house of his servant David
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (As he spake by the mouth of his holy prophets that have been from of old),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Salvation from our enemies, and from the hand of all that hate us;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To show mercy towards our fathers,
And to remember his holy covenant;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The oath which he sware unto Abraham our father,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To grant unto us that we being delivered out of the hand of our enemies
Should serve him without fear,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In holiness and righteousness before him all our days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yea and thou, child, shalt be called the prophet of the Most High:
For thou shalt go before the face of the Lord to make ready his ways;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To give knowledge of salvation unto his people
In the remission of their sins,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Because of the tender mercy of our God,
Whereby the dayspring from on high shall visit us,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To shine upon them that sit in darkness and the shadow of death;
To guide our feet into the way of peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the child grew, and waxed strong in spirit, and was in the deserts till the day of his showing unto Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it came to pass in those days, there went out a decree from Caesar Augustus, that all the world should be enrolled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This was the first enrolment made when Quirinius was governor of Syria.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all went to enrol themselves, every one to his own city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Joseph also went up from Galilee, out of the city of Nazareth, into Judaea, to the city of David, which is called Bethlehem, because he was of the house and family of David;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to enrol himself with Mary, who was betrothed to him, being great with child.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass, while they were there, the days were fulfilled that she should be delivered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And she brought forth her firstborn son; and she wrapped him in swaddling clothes, and laid him in a manger, because there was no room for them in the inn.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there were shepherds in the same country abiding in the field, and keeping watch by night over their flock.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And an angel of the Lord stood by them, and the glory of the Lord shone round about them: and they were sore afraid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the angel said unto them, Be not afraid; for behold, I bring you good tidings of great joy which shall be to all the people:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for there is born to you this day in the city of David a Saviour, who is Christ the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And this is the sign unto you: Ye shall find a babe wrapped in swaddling clothes, and lying in a manger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And suddenly there was with the angel a multitude of the heavenly host praising God, and saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Glory to God in the highest,
And on earth peace among men in whom he is well pleased.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass, when the angels went away from them into heaven, the shepherds said one to another, Let us now go even unto Bethlehem, and see this thing that is come to pass, which the Lord hath made known unto us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they came with haste, and found both Mary and Joseph, and the babe lying in the manger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they saw it, they made known concerning the saying which was spoken to them about this child.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all that heard it wondered at the things which were spoken unto them by the shepherds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Mary kept all these sayings, pondering them in her heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the shepherds returned, glorifying and praising God for all the things that they had heard and seen, even as it was spoken unto them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when eight days were fulfilled for circumcising him, his name was called Jesus, which was so called by the angel before he was conceived in the womb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the days of their purification according to the law of Moses were fulfilled, they brought him up to Jerusalem, to present him to the Lord
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (as it is written in the law of the Lord, Every male that openeth the womb shall be called holy to the Lord),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and to offer a sacrifice according to that which is said in the law of the Lord, A pair of turtledoves, or two young pigeons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, there was a man in Jerusalem, whose name was Simeon; and this man was righteous and devout, looking for the consolation of Israel: and the Holy Spirit was upon him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it had been revealed unto him by the Holy Spirit, that he should not see death, before he had seen the Lord’s Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he came in the Spirit into the temple: and when the parents brought in the child Jesus, that they might do concerning him after the custom of the law,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then he received him into his arms, and blessed God, and said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Now lettest thou thy servant depart, Lord,
According to thy word, in peace;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For mine eyes have seen thy salvation,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Which thou hast prepared before the face of all peoples;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A light for revelation to the Gentiles,
And the glory of thy people Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And his father and his mother were marvelling at the things which were spoken concerning him;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Simeon blessed them, and said unto Mary his mother, Behold, this child is set for the falling and the rising of many in Israel; and for a sign which is spoken against;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: yea and a sword shall pierce through thine own soul; that thoughts out of many hearts may be revealed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there was one Anna, a prophetess, the daughter of Phanuel, of the tribe of Asher (she was of a great age, having lived with a husband seven years from her virginity,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and she had been a widow even unto fourscore and four years), who departed not from the temple, worshipping with fastings and supplications night and day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And coming up at that very hour she gave thanks unto God, and spake of him to all them that were looking for the redemption of Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they had accomplished all things that were according to the law of the Lord, they returned into Galilee, to their own city Nazareth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the child grew, and waxed strong, filled with wisdom: and the grace of God was upon him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And his parents went every year to Jerusalem at the feast of the passover.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he was twelve years old, they went up after the custom of the feast;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and when they had fulfilled the days, as they were returning, the boy Jesus tarried behind in Jerusalem; and his parents knew it not;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but supposing him to be in the company, they went a day’s journey; and they sought for him among their kinsfolk and acquaintance:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and when they found him not, they returned to Jerusalem, seeking for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass, after three days they found him in the temple, sitting in the midst of the teachers, both hearing them, and asking them questions:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and all that heard him were amazed at his understanding and his answers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they saw him, they were astonished; and his mother said unto him, Son, why hast thou thus dealt with us? behold, thy father and I sought thee sorrowing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto them, How is it that ye sought me? knew ye not that I must be in my Father’s house?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And they understood not the saying which he spake unto them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he went down with them, and came to Nazareth; and he was subject unto them: and his mother kept all these sayings in her heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus advanced in wisdom and stature, and in favor with God and men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now in the fifteenth year of the reign of Tiberius Caesar, Pontius Pilate being governor of Judaea, and Herod being tetrarch of Galilee, and his brother Philip tetrarch of the region of Ituraea and Trachonitis, and Lysanias tetrarch of Abilene,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in the high-priesthood of Annas and Caiaphas, the word of God came unto John the son of Zacharias in the wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he came into all the region round about the Jordan, preaching the baptism of repentance unto remission of sins;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
as it is written in the book of the words of Isaiah the prophet,
The voice of one crying in the wilderness,
Make ye ready the way of the Lord,
Make his paths straight.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: And all flesh shall see the salvation of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said therefore to the multitudes that went out to be baptized of him, Ye offspring of vipers, who warned you to flee from the wrath to come?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Bring forth therefore fruits worthy of repentance, and begin not to say within yourselves, We have Abraham to our father: for I say unto you, that God is able of these stones to raise up children unto Abraham.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And even now the axe also lieth at the root of the trees: every tree therefore that bringeth not forth good fruit is hewn down, and cast into the fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the multitudes asked him, saying, What then must we do?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he answered and said unto them, He that hath two coats, let him impart to him that hath none; and he that hath food, let him do likewise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there came also publicans to be baptized, and they said unto him, Teacher, what must we do?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto them, Extort no more than that which is appointed you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And soldiers also asked him, saying, And we, what must we do? And he said unto them, Extort from no man by violence, neither accuse any one wrongfully; and be content with your wages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as the people were in expectation, and all men reasoned in their hearts concerning John, whether haply he were the Christ;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John answered, saying unto them all, I indeed baptize you with water; but there cometh he that is mightier than I, the latchet of whose shoes I am not worthy to unloose: he shall baptize you in the Holy Spirit and in fire:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: whose fan is in his hand, thoroughly to cleanse his threshing-floor, and to gather the wheat into his garner; but the chaff he will burn up with unquenchable fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: With many other exhortations therefore preached he good tidings unto the people;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but Herod the tetrarch, being reproved by him for Herodias his brother’s wife, and for all the evil things which Herod had done,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: added this also to them all, that he shut up John in prison.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it came to pass, when all the people were baptized, that, Jesus also having been baptized, and praying, the heaven was opened,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the Holy Spirit descended in a bodily form, as a dove, upon him, and a voice came out of heaven, Thou art my beloved Son; in thee I am well pleased.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus himself, when he began to teach, was about thirty years of age, being the son (as was supposed) of Joseph, the son of Heli,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Matthat, the son of Levi, the son of Melchi, the son of Jannai, the son of Joseph,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Mattathias, the son of Amos, the son of Nahum, the son of Esli, the son of Naggai,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Maath, the son of Mattathias, the son of Semein, the son of Josech, the son of Joda,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Joanan, the son of Rhesa, the son of Zerubbabel, the son of Shealtiel, the son of Neri,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Melchi, the son of Addi, the son of Cosam, the son of Elmadam, the son of Er,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Jesus, the son of Eliezer, the son of Jorim, the son of Matthat, the son of Levi,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Symeon, the son of Judas, the son of Joseph, the son of Jonam, the son of Eliakim,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Melea, the son of Menna, the son of Mattatha, the son of Nathan, the son of David,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Jesse, the son of Obed, the son of Boaz, the son of Salmon, the son of Nahshon,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Amminadab, the son of Arni, the son of Hezron, the son of Perez, the son of Judah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Jacob, the son of Isaac, the son of Abraham, the son of Terah, the son of Nahor,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Serug, the son of Reu, the son of Peleg, the son of Eber, the son of Shelah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Cainan, the son of Arphaxad, the son of Shem, the son of Noah, the son of Lamech,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Methuselah, the son of Enoch, the son of Jared, the son of Mahalaleel, the son of Cainan,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Enos, the son of Seth, the son of Adam, the son of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus, full of the Holy Spirit, returned from the Jordan, and was led in the Spirit in the wilderness
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: during forty days, being tempted of the devil. And he did eat nothing in those days: and when they were completed, he hungered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the devil said unto him, If thou art the Son of God, command this stone that it become bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus answered unto him, It is written, Man shall not live by bread alone.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And he led him up, and showed him all the kingdoms of the world in a moment of time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the devil said unto him, To thee will I give all this authority, and the glory of them: for it hath been delivered unto me; and to whomsoever I will I give it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If thou therefore wilt worship before me, it shall all be thine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus answered and said unto him, It is written, Thou shalt worship the Lord thy God, and him only shalt thou serve.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And he led him to Jerusalem, and set him on the pinnacle of the temple, and said unto him, If thou art the Son of God, cast thyself down from hence:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for it is written,
He shall give his angels charge concerning thee, to guard thee:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and,
On their hands they shall bear thee up,
Lest haply thou dash thy foot against a stone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus answering said unto him, It is said, Thou shalt not make trial of the Lord thy God.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And when the devil had completed every temptation, he departed from him for a season.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus returned in the power of the Spirit into Galilee: and a fame went out concerning him through all the region round about.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he taught in their synagogues, being glorified of all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he came to Nazareth, where he had been brought up: and he entered, as his custom was, into the synagogue on the sabbath day, and stood up to read.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there was delivered unto him the book of the prophet Isaiah. And he opened the book, and found the place where it was written,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Spirit of the Lord is upon me,
Because he anointed me to preach good tidings to the poor:
He hath sent me to proclaim release to the captives,
And recovering of sight to the blind,
To set at liberty them that are bruised,
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: To proclaim the acceptable year of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he closed the book, and gave it back to the attendant, and sat down: and the eyes of all in the synagogue were fastened on him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he began to say unto them, To-day hath this scripture been fulfilled in your ears.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And all bare him witness, and wondered at the words of grace which proceeded out of his mouth: and they said, Is not this Joseph’s son?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto them, Doubtless ye will say unto me this parable, Physician, heal thyself: whatsoever we have heard done at Capernaum, do also here in thine own country.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And he said, Verily I say unto you, No prophet is acceptable in his own country.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But of a truth I say unto you, There were many widows in Israel in the days of Elijah, when the heaven was shut up three years and six months, when there came a great famine over all the land;
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: and unto none of them was Elijah sent, but only to Zarephath, in the land of Sidon, unto a woman that was a widow.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And there were many lepers in Israel in the time of Elisha the prophet; and none of them was cleansed, but only Naaman the Syrian.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And they were all filled with wrath in the synagogue, as they heard these things;
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: and they rose up, and cast him forth out of the city, and led him unto the brow of the hill whereon their city was built, that they might throw him down headlong.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he passing through the midst of them went his way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he came down to Capernaum, a city of Galilee. And he was teaching them on the sabbath day:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they were astonished at his teaching; for his word was with authority.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in the synagogue there was a man, that had a spirit of an unclean demon; and he cried out with a loud voice,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ah! what have we to do with thee, Jesus thou Nazarene? art thou come to destroy us? I know thee who thou art, the Holy One of God.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And Jesus rebuked him, saying, Hold thy peace, and come out of him. And when the demon had thrown him down in the midst, he came out of him, having done him no hurt.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And amazement came upon all, and they spake together, one with another, saying, What is this word? for with authority and power he commandeth the unclean spirits, and they come out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there went forth a rumor concerning him into every place of the region round about.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he rose up from the synagogue, and entered into the house of Simon. And Simon’s wife’s mother was holden with a great fever; and they besought him for her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he stood over her, and rebuked the fever; and it left her: and immediately she rose up and ministered unto them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the sun was setting, all they that had any sick with divers diseases brought them unto him; and he laid his hands on every one of them, and healed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And demons also came out from many, crying out, and saying, Thou art the Son of God. And rebuking them, he suffered them not to speak, because they knew that he was the Christ.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And when it was day, he came out and went into a desert place: and the multitudes sought after him, and came unto him, and would have stayed him, that he should not go from them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he said unto them, I must preach the good tidings of the kingdom of God to the other cities also: for therefore was I sent.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And he was preaching in the synagogues of Galilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it came to pass, while the multitude pressed upon him and heard the word of God, that he was standing by the lake of Gennesaret;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he saw two boats standing by the lake: but the fishermen had gone out of them, and were washing their nets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he entered into one of the boats, which was Simon’s, and asked him to put out a little from the land. And he sat down and taught the multitudes out of the boat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he had left speaking, he said unto Simon, Put out into the deep, and let down your nets for a draught.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Simon answered and said, Master, we toiled all night, and took nothing: but at thy word I will let down the nets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they had done this, they inclosed a great multitude of fishes; and their nets were breaking;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they beckoned unto their partners in the other boat, that they should come and help them. And they came, and filled both the boats, so that they began to sink.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Simon Peter, when he saw it, fell down at Jesus’ knees, saying, Depart from me; for I am a sinful man, O Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he was amazed, and all that were with him, at the draught of the fishes which they had taken;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and so were also James and John, sons of Zebedee, who were partners with Simon. And Jesus said unto Simon, Fear not; from henceforth thou shalt catch men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they had brought their boats to land, they left all, and followed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass, while he was in one of the cities, behold, a man full of leprosy: and when he saw Jesus, he fell on his face, and besought him, saying, Lord, if thou wilt, thou canst make me clean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he stretched forth his hand, and touched him, saying, I will; be thou made clean. And straightway the leprosy departed from him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he charged him to tell no man: but go thy way, and show thyself to the priest, and offer for thy cleansing, according as Moses commanded, for a testimony unto them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But so much the more went abroad the report concerning him: and great multitudes came together to hear, and to be healed of their infirmities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he withdrew himself in the deserts, and prayed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass on one of those days, that he was teaching; and there were Pharisees and doctors of the law sitting by, who were come out of every village of Galilee and Judaea and Jerusalem: and the power of the Lord was with him to heal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, men bring on a bed a man that was palsied: and they sought to bring him in, and to lay him before him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And not finding by what way they might bring him in because of the multitude, they went up to the housetop, and let him down through the tiles with his couch into the midst before Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And seeing their faith, he said, Man, thy sins are forgiven thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the scribes and the Pharisees began to reason, saying, Who is this that speaketh blasphemies? Who can forgive sins, but God alone?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus perceiving their reasonings, answered and said unto them, Why reason ye in your hearts?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Which is easier, to say, Thy sins are forgiven thee; or to say, Arise and walk?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But that ye may know that the Son of man hath authority on earth to forgive sins (he said unto him that was palsied), I say unto thee, Arise, and take up thy couch, and go unto thy house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And immediately he rose up before them, and took up that whereon he lay, and departed to his house, glorifying God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And amazement took hold on all, and they glorified God; and they were filled with fear, saying, We have seen strange things to-day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after these things he went forth, and beheld a publican, named Levi, sitting at the place of toll, and said unto him, Follow me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he forsook all, and rose up and followed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Levi made him a great feast in his house: and there was a great multitude of publicans and of others that were sitting at meat with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Pharisees and their scribes murmured against his disciples, saying, Why do ye eat and drink with the publicans and sinners?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus answering said unto them, They that are in health have no need of a physician; but they that are sick.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am not come to call the righteous but sinners to repentance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said unto him, The disciples of John fast often, and make supplications; likewise also the disciples of the Pharisees; but thine eat and drink.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus said unto them, Can ye make the sons of the bride-chamber fast, while the bridegroom is with them?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the days will come; and when the bridegroom shall be taken away from them, then will they fast in those days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he spake also a parable unto them: No man rendeth a piece from a new garment and putteth it upon an old garment; else he will rend the new, and also the piece from the new will not agree with the old.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And no man putteth new wine into old wine-skins; else the new wine will burst the skins, and itself will be spilled, and the skins will perish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But new wine must be put into fresh wine-skins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And no man having drunk old wine desireth new; for he saith, The old is good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it came to pass on a sabbath, that he was going through the grainfields; and his disciples plucked the ears, and did eat, rubbing them in their hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But certain of the Pharisees said, Why do ye that which it is not lawful to do on the sabbath day?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus answering them said, Have ye not read even this, what David did, when he was hungry, he, and they that were with him;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: how he entered into the house of God, and took and ate the showbread, and gave also to them that were with him; which it is not lawful to eat save for the priests alone?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto them, The Son of man is lord of the sabbath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass on another sabbath, that he entered into the synagogue and taught: and there was a man there, and his right hand was withered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the scribes and the Pharisees watched him, whether he would heal on the sabbath; that they might find how to accuse him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he knew their thoughts; and he said to the man that had his hand withered, Rise up, and stand forth in the midst. And he arose and stood forth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus said unto them, I ask you, Is it lawful on the sabbath to do good, or to do harm? to save a life, or to destroy it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he looked round about on them all, and said unto him, Stretch forth thy hand. And he did so: and his hand was restored.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they were filled with madness; and communed one with another what they might do to Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass in these days, that he went out into the mountain to pray; and he continued all night in prayer to God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when it was day, he called his disciples; and he chose from them twelve, whom also he named apostles:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simon, whom he also named Peter, and Andrew his brother, and James and John, and Philip and Bartholomew,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Matthew and Thomas, and James the son of Alphaeus, and Simon who was called the Zealot,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Judas the son of James, and Judas Iscariot, who became a traitor;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he came down with them, and stood on a level place, and a great multitude of his disciples, and a great number of the people from all Judaea and Jerusalem, and the sea coast of Tyre and Sidon, who came to hear him, and to be healed of their diseases;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they that were troubled with unclean spirits were healed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the multitude sought to touch him; for power came forth from him, and healed them all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he lifted up his eyes on his disciples, and said, Blessed are ye poor: for yours is the kingdom of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Blessed are ye that hunger now: for ye shall be filled. Blessed are ye that weep now: for ye shall laugh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Blessed are ye, when men shall hate you, and when they shall separate you from their company, and reproach you, and cast out your name as evil, for the Son of man’s sake.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Rejoice in that day, and leap for joy: for behold, your reward is great in heaven; for in the same manner did their fathers unto the prophets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But woe unto you that are rich! for ye have received your consolation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Woe unto you, ye that are full now! for ye shall hunger. Woe unto you, ye that laugh now! for ye shall mourn and weep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Woe unto you, when all men shall speak well of you! for in the same manner did their fathers to the false prophets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I say unto you that hear, Love your enemies, do good to them that hate you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: bless them that curse you, pray for them that despitefully use you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To him that smiteth thee on the one cheek offer also the other; and from him that taketh away thy cloak withhold not thy coat also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Give to every one that asketh thee; and of him that taketh away thy goods ask them not again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as ye would that men should do to you, do ye also to them likewise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if ye love them that love you, what thank have ye? for even sinners love those that love them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if ye do good to them that do good to you, what thank have ye? for even sinners do the same.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if ye lend to them of whom ye hope to receive, what thank have ye? even sinners lend to sinners, to receive again as much.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But love your enemies, and do them good, and lend, never despairing; and your reward shall be great, and ye shall be sons of the Most High: for he is kind toward the unthankful and evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be ye merciful, even as your Father is merciful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And judge not, and ye shall not be judged: and condemn not, and ye shall not be condemned: release, and ye shall be released:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: give, and it shall be given unto you; good measure, pressed down, shaken together, running over, shall they give into your bosom. For with what measure ye mete it shall be measured to you again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he spake also a parable unto them, Can the blind guide the blind? shall they not both fall into a pit?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The disciple is not above his teacher: but every one when he is perfected shall be as his teacher.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And why beholdest thou the mote that is in thy brother’s eye, but considerest not the beam that is in thine own eye?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or how canst thou say to thy brother, Brother, let me cast out the mote that is in thine eye, when thou thyself beholdest not the beam that is in thine own eye? Thou hypocrite, cast out first the beam out of thine own eye, and then shalt thou see clearly to cast out the mote that is in thy brother’s eye.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For there is no good tree that bringeth forth corrupt fruit; nor again a corrupt tree that bringeth forth good fruit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For each tree is known by its own fruit. For of thorns men do not gather figs, nor of a bramble bush gather they grapes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The good man out of the good treasure of his heart bringeth forth that which is good; and the evil man out of the evil treasure bringeth forth that which is evil: for out of the abundance of the heart his mouth speaketh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And why call ye me, Lord, Lord, and do not the things which I say?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every one that cometh unto me, and heareth my words, and doeth them, I will show you to whom he is like:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he is like a man building a house, who digged and went deep, and laid a foundation upon the rock: and when a flood arose, the stream brake against that house, and could not shake it: because it had been well builded.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he that heareth, and doeth not, is like a man that built a house upon the earth without a foundation; against which the stream brake, and straightway it fell in; and the ruin of that house was great.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After he had ended all his sayings in the ears of the people, he entered into Capernaum.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a certain centurion’s servant, who was dear unto him, was sick and at the point of death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he heard concerning Jesus, he sent unto him elders of the Jews, asking him that he would come and save his servant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they, when they came to Jesus, besought him earnestly, saying, He is worthy that thou shouldest do this for him;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for he loveth our nation, and himself built us our synagogue.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus went with them. And when he was now not far from the house, the centurion sent friends to him, saying unto him, Lord, trouble not thyself; for I am not worthy that thou shouldest come under my roof:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: wherefore neither thought I myself worthy to come unto thee: but say the word, and my servant shall be healed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I also am a man set under authority, having under myself soldiers: and I say to this one, Go, and he goeth; and to another, Come, and he cometh; and to my servant, Do this, and he doeth it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Jesus heard these things, he marvelled at him, and turned and said unto the multitude that followed him, I say unto you, I have not found so great faith, no, not in Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they that were sent, returning to the house, found the servant whole.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass soon afterwards, that he went to a city called Nain; and his disciples went with him, and a great multitude.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when he drew near to the gate of the city, behold, there was carried out one that was dead, the only son of his mother, and she was a widow: and much people of the city was with her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the Lord saw her, he had compassion on her, and said unto her, Weep not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he came nigh and touched the bier: and the bearers stood still. And he said, Young man, I say unto thee, Arise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he that was dead sat up, and began to speak. And he gave him to his mother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And fear took hold on all: and they glorified God, saying, A great prophet is arisen among us: and, God hath visited his people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And this report went forth concerning him in the whole of Judaea, and all the region round about.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the disciples of John told him of all these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And John calling unto him two of his disciples sent them to the Lord, saying, Art thou he that cometh, or look we for another?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the men were come unto him, they said, John the Baptist hath sent us unto thee, saying, Art thou he that cometh, or look we for another?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In that hour he cured many of diseases and plagues and evil spirits; and on many that were blind he bestowed sight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he answered and said unto them, Go and tell John the things which ye have seen and heard; the blind receive their sight, the lame walk, the lepers are cleansed, and the deaf hear, the dead are raised up, the poor have good tidings preached to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And blessed is he, whosoever shall find no occasion of stumbling in me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the messengers of John were departed, he began to say unto the multitudes concerning John, What went ye out into the wilderness to behold? a reed shaken with the wind?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But what went ye out to see? a man clothed in soft raiment? Behold, they that are gorgeously apparelled, and live delicately, are in kings’ courts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But what went ye out to see? a prophet? Yea, I say unto you, and much more than a prophet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is he of whom it is written,
Behold, I send my messenger before thy face,
Who shall prepare thy way before thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I say unto you, Among them that are born of women there is none greater than John: yet he that is but little in the kingdom of God is greater than he.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the people when they heard, and the publicans, justified God, being baptized with the baptism of John.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Pharisees and the lawyers rejected for themselves the counsel of God, being not baptized of him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whereunto then shall I liken the men of this generation, and to what are they like?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They are like unto children that sit in the marketplace, and call one to another; who say, We piped unto you, and ye did not dance; we wailed, and ye did not weep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For John the Baptist is come eating no bread nor drinking wine; and ye say, He hath a demon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Son of man is come eating and drinking; and ye say, Behold, a gluttonous man, and a winebibber, a friend of publicans and sinners!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And wisdom is justified of all her children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And one of the Pharisees desired him that he would eat with him. And he entered into the Pharisee’s house, and sat down to meat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, a woman who was in the city, a sinner; and when she knew that he was sitting at meat in the Pharisee’s house, she brought an alabaster cruse of ointment,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and standing behind at his feet, weeping, she began to wet his feet with her tears, and wiped them with the hair of her head, and kissed his feet, and anointed them with the ointment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when the Pharisee that had bidden him saw it, he spake within himself, saying, This man, if he were a prophet, would have perceived who and what manner of woman this is that toucheth him, that she is a sinner.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus answering said unto him, Simon, I have somewhat to say unto thee. And he saith, Teacher, say on.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A certain lender had two debtors: the one owed five hundred shillings, and the other fifty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they had not wherewith to pay, he forgave them both. Which of them therefore will love him most?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simon answered and said, He, I suppose, to whom he forgave the most. And he said unto him, Thou hast rightly judged.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And turning to the woman, he said unto Simon, Seest thou this woman? I entered into thy house, thou gavest me no water for my feet: but she hath wetted my feet with her tears, and wiped them with her hair.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou gavest me no kiss: but she, since the time I came in, hath not ceased to kiss my feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My head with oil thou didst not anoint: but she hath anointed my feet with ointment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wherefore I say unto thee, Her sins, which are many, are forgiven; for she loved much: but to whom little is forgiven, the same loveth little.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto her, Thy sins are forgiven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they that sat at meat with him began to say within themselves, Who is this that even forgiveth sins?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto the woman, Thy faith hath saved thee; go in peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass soon afterwards, that he went about through cities and villages, preaching and bringing the good tidings of the kingdom of God, and with him the twelve,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and certain women who had been healed of evil spirits and infirmities: Mary that was called Magdalene, from whom seven demons had gone out,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Joanna the wife of Chuzas Herod’s steward, and Susanna, and many others, who ministered unto them of their substance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when a great multitude came together, and they of every city resorted unto him, he spake by a parable:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sower went forth to sow his seed: and as he sowed, some fell by the way side; and it was trodden under foot, and the birds of the heaven devoured it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And other fell on the rock; and as soon as it grew, it withered away, because it had no moisture.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And other fell amidst the thorns; and the thorns grew with it, and choked it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And other fell into the good ground, and grew, and brought forth fruit a hundredfold. As he said these things, he cried, He that hath ears to hear, let him hear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And his disciples asked him what this parable might be.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, Unto you it is given to know the mysteries of the kingdom of God: but to the rest in parables; that seeing they may not see, and hearing they may not understand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the parable is this: The seed is the word of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And those by the way side are they that have heard; then cometh the devil, and taketh away the word from their heart, that they may not believe and be saved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And those on the rock are they who, when they have heard, receive the word with joy; and these have no root, who for a while believe, and in time of temptation fall away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And that which fell among the thorns, these are they that have heard, and as they go on their way they are choked with cares and riches and pleasures of this life, and bring no fruit to perfection.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And that in the good ground, these are such as in an honest and good heart, having heard the word, hold it fast, and bring forth fruit with patience.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And no man, when he hath lighted a lamp, covereth it with a vessel, or putteth it under a bed; but putteth it on a stand, that they that enter in may see the light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For nothing is hid, that shall not be made manifest; nor anything secret, that shall not be known and come to light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take heed therefore how ye hear: for whosoever hath, to him shall be given; and whosoever hath not, from him shall be taken away even that which he thinketh he hath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there came to him his mother and brethren, and they could not come at him for the crowd.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it was told him, Thy mother and thy brethren stand without, desiring to see thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he answered and said unto them, My mother and my brethren are these that hear the word of God, and do it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it came to pass on one of those days, that he entered into a boat, himself and his disciples; and he said unto them, Let us go over unto the other side of the lake: and they launched forth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But as they sailed he fell asleep: and there came down a storm of wind on the lake; and they were filling with water, and were in jeopardy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they came to him, and awoke him, saying, Master, master, we perish. And he awoke, and rebuked the wind and the raging of the water: and they ceased, and there was a calm.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto them, Where is your faith? And being afraid they marvelled, saying one to another, Who then is this, that he commandeth even the winds and the water, and they obey him?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they arrived at the country of the Gerasenes, which is over against Galilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he was come forth upon the land, there met him a certain man out of the city, who had demons; and for a long time he had worn no clothes, and abode not in any house, but in the tombs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he saw Jesus, he cried out, and fell down before him, and with a loud voice said, What have I to do with thee, Jesus, thou Son of the Most High God? I beseech thee, torment me not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he was commanding the unclean spirit to come out from the man. For oftentimes it had seized him: and he was kept under guard, and bound with chains and fetters; and breaking the bands asunder, he was driven of the demon into the deserts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus asked him, What is thy name? And he said, Legion; for many demons were entered into him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they entreated him that he would not command them to depart into the abyss.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now there was there a herd of many swine feeding on the mountain: and they entreated him that he would give them leave to enter into them. And he gave them leave.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the demons came out from the man, and entered into the swine: and the herd rushed down the steep into the lake, and were drowned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they that fed them saw what had come to pass, they fled, and told it in the city and in the country.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they went out to see what had come to pass; and they came to Jesus, and found the man, from whom the demons were gone out, sitting, clothed and in his right mind, at the feet of Jesus: and they were afraid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they that saw it told them how he that was possessed with demons was made whole.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the people of the country of the Gerasenes round about asked him to depart from them; for they were holden with great fear: and he entered into a boat, and returned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the man from whom the demons were gone out prayed him that he might be with him: but he sent him away, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Return to thy house, and declare how great things God hath done for thee. And he went his way, publishing throughout the whole city how great things Jesus had done for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as Jesus returned, the multitude welcomed him; for they were all waiting for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, there came a man named Jairus, and he was a ruler of the synagogue: and he fell down at Jesus’ feet, and besought him to come into his house;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for he had an only daughter, about twelve years of age, and she was dying. But as he went the multitudes thronged him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a woman having an issue of blood twelve years, who had spent all her living upon physicians, and could not be healed of any,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: came behind him, and touched the border of his garment: and immediately the issue of her blood stanched.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus said, Who is it that touched me? And when all denied, Peter said, and they that were with him, Master, the multitudes press thee and crush thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus said, Some one did touch me; for I perceived that power had gone forth from me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the woman saw that she was not hid, she came trembling, and falling down before him declared in the presence of all the people for what cause she touched him, and how she was healed immediately.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto her, Daughter, thy faith hath made thee whole; go in peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While he yet spake, there cometh one from the ruler of the synagogue’s house, saying, Thy daughter is dead; trouble not the Teacher.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus hearing it, answered him, Fear not: only believe, and she shall be made whole.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he came to the house, he suffered not any man to enter in with him, save Peter, and John, and James, and the father of the maiden and her mother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all were weeping, and bewailing her: but he said, Weep not; for she is not dead, but sleepeth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they laughed him to scorn, knowing that she was dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he, taking her by the hand, called, saying, Maiden, arise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And her spirit returned, and she rose up immediately: and he commanded that something be given her to eat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And her parents were amazed: but he charged them to tell no man what had been done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he called the twelve together, and gave them power and authority over all demons, and to cure diseases.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he sent them forth to preach the kingdom of God, and to heal the sick.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto them, Take nothing for your journey, neither staff, nor wallet, nor bread, nor money; neither have two coats.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And into whatsoever house ye enter, there abide, and thence depart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as many as receive you not, when ye depart from that city, shake off the dust from your feet for a testimony against them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they departed, and went throughout the villages, preaching the gospel, and healing everywhere.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Herod the tetrarch heard of all that was done: and he was much perplexed, because that it was said by some, that John was risen from the dead;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and by some, that Elijah had appeared; and by others, that one of the old prophets was risen again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Herod said, John I beheaded: but who is this, about whom I hear such things? And he sought to see him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the apostles, when they were returned, declared unto him what things they had done. And he took them, and withdrew apart to a city called Bethsaida.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the multitudes perceiving it followed him: and he welcomed them, and spake to them of the kingdom of God, and them that had need of healing he cured.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the day began to wear away; and the twelve came, and said unto him, Send the multitude away, that they may go into the villages and country round about, and lodge, and get provisions: for we are here in a desert place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he said unto them, Give ye them to eat. And they said, We have no more than five loaves and two fishes; except we should go and buy food for all this people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For they were about five thousand men. And he said unto his disciples, Make them sit down in companies, about fifty each.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they did so, and made them all sit down.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he took the five loaves and the two fishes, and looking up to heaven, he blessed them, and brake; and gave to the disciples to set before the multitude.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they ate, and were all filled: and there was taken up that which remained over to them of broken pieces, twelve baskets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass, as he was praying apart, the disciples were with him: and he asked them, saying, Who do the multitudes say that I am?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they answering said, John the Baptist; but others say, Elijah; and others, that one of the old prophets is risen again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto them, But who say ye that I am? And Peter answering said, The Christ of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he charged them, and commanded them to tell this to no man;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, The Son of man must suffer many things, and be rejected of the elders and chief priests and scribes, and be killed, and the third day be raised up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto all, If any man would come after me, let him deny himself, and take up his cross daily, and follow me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For whosoever would save his life shall lose it; but whosoever shall lose his life for my sake, the same shall save it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For what is a man profited, if he gain the whole world, and lose or forfeit his own self?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For whosoever shall be ashamed of me and of my words, of him shall the Son of man be ashamed, when he cometh in his own glory, and the glory of the Father, and of the holy angels.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I tell you of a truth, There are some of them that stand here, who shall in no wise taste of death, till they see the kingdom of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass about eight days after these sayings, that he took with him Peter and John and James, and went up into the mountain to pray.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as he was praying, the fashion of his countenance was altered, and his raiment became white and dazzling.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, there talked with him two men, who were Moses and Elijah;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who appeared in glory, and spake of his decease which he was about to accomplish at Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Peter and they that were with him were heavy with sleep: but when they were fully awake, they saw his glory, and the two men that stood with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass, as they were parting from him, Peter said unto Jesus, Master, it is good for us to be here: and let us make three tabernacles; one for thee, and one for Moses, and one for Elijah: not knowing what he said.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And while he said these things, there came a cloud, and overshadowed them: and they feared as they entered into the cloud.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a voice came out of the cloud, saying, This is my Son, my chosen: hear ye him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the voice came, Jesus was found alone. And they held their peace, and told no man in those days any of the things which they had seen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass, on the next day, when they were come down from the mountain, a great multitude met him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, a man from the multitude cried, saying, Teacher, I beseech thee to look upon my son; for he is mine only child:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and behold, a spirit taketh him, and he suddenly crieth out; and it teareth him that he foameth, and it hardly departeth from him, bruising him sorely.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I besought thy disciples to cast it out; and they could not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus answered and said, O faithless and perverse generation, how long shall I be with you, and bear with you? bring hither thy son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as he was yet a coming, the demon dashed him down, and tare him grievously. But Jesus rebuked the unclean spirit, and healed the boy, and gave him back to his father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And they were all astonished at the majesty of God.
But while all were marvelling at all the things which he did, he said unto his disciples,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let these words sink into your ears: for the Son of man shall be delivered up into the hands of men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they understood not this saying, and it was concealed from them, that they should not perceive it; and they were afraid to ask him about this saying.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there arose a reasoning among them, which of them was the greatest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when Jesus saw the reasoning of their heart, he took a little child, and set him by his side,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said unto them, Whosoever shall receive this little child in my name receiveth me: and whosoever shall receive me receiveth him that sent me: for he that is least among you all, the same is great.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And John answered and said, Master, we saw one casting out demons in thy name; and we forbade him, because he followeth not with us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus said unto him, Forbid him not: for he that is not against you is for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass, when the days were well-nigh come that he should be received up, he stedfastly set his face to go to Jerusalem,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and sent messengers before his face: and they went, and entered into a village of the Samaritans, to make ready for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they did not receive him, because his face was as though he were going to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when his disciples James and John saw this, they said, Lord, wilt thou that we bid fire to come down from heaven, and consume them?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he turned, and rebuked them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they went to another village.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as they went on the way, a certain man said unto him, I will follow thee whithersoever thou goest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus said unto him, The foxes have holes, and the birds of the heaven have nests; but the Son of man hath not where to lay his head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto another, Follow me. But he said, Lord, suffer me first to go and bury my father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he said unto him, Leave the dead to bury their own dead; but go thou and publish abroad the kingdom of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And another also said, I will follow thee, Lord; but first suffer me to bid farewell to them that are at my house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus said unto him, No man, having put his hand to the plow, and looking back, is fit for the kingdom of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now after these things the Lord appointed seventy others, and sent them two and two before his face into every city and place, whither he himself was about to come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto them, The harvest indeed is plenteous, but the laborers are few: pray ye therefore the Lord of the harvest, that he send forth laborers into his harvest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Go your ways; behold, I send you forth as lambs in the midst of wolves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Carry no purse, no wallet, no shoes; and salute no man on the way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And into whatsoever house ye shall enter, first say, Peace be to this house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if a son of peace be there, your peace shall rest upon him: but if not, it shall turn to you again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in that same house remain, eating and drinking such things as they give: for the laborer is worthy of his hire. Go not from house to house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And into whatsoever city ye enter, and they receive you, eat such things as are set before you:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and heal the sick that are therein, and say unto them, The kingdom of God is come nigh unto you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But into whatsoever city ye shall enter, and they receive you not, go out into the streets thereof and say,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even the dust from your city, that cleaveth to our feet, we wipe off against you: nevertheless know this, that the kingdom of God is come nigh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I say unto you, It shall be more tolerable in that day for Sodom, than for that city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Woe unto thee, Chorazin! woe unto thee, Bethsaida! for if the mighty works had been done in Tyre and Sidon, which were done in you, they would have repented long ago, sitting in sackcloth and ashes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But it shall be more tolerable for Tyre and Sidon in the judgment, than for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou, Capernaum, shalt thou be exalted unto heaven? thou shalt be brought down unto Hades.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that heareth you heareth me; and he that rejecteth you rejecteth me; and he that rejecteth me rejecteth him that sent me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the seventy returned with joy, saying, Lord, even the demons are subject unto us in thy name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto them, I beheld Satan fallen as lightning from heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, I have given you authority to tread upon serpents and scorpions, and over all the power of the enemy: and nothing shall in any wise hurt you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nevertheless in this rejoice not, that the spirits are subject unto you; but rejoice that your names are written in heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In that same hour he rejoiced in the Holy Spirit, and said, I thank thee, O Father, Lord of heaven and earth, that thou didst hide these things from the wise and understanding, and didst reveal them unto babes: yea, Father; for so it was well-pleasing in thy sight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All things have been delivered unto me of my Father: and no one knoweth who the Son is, save the Father; and who the Father is, save the Son, and he to whomsoever the Son willeth to reveal him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And turning to the disciples, he said privately, Blessed are the eyes which see the things that ye see:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for I say unto you, that many prophets and kings desired to see the things which ye see, and saw them not; and to hear the things which ye hear, and heard them not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, a certain lawyer stood up and made trial of him, saying, Teacher, what shall I do to inherit eternal life?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto him, What is written in the law? how readest thou?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he answering said, Thou shalt love the Lord thy God with all thy heart, and with all thy soul, and with all thy strength, and with all thy mind; and thy neighbor as thyself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto him, Thou hast answered right: this do, and thou shalt live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he, desiring to justify himself, said unto Jesus, And who is my neighbor?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus made answer and said, A certain man was going down from Jerusalem to Jericho; and he fell among robbers, who both stripped him and beat him, and departed, leaving him half dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And by chance a certain priest was going down that way: and when he saw him, he passed by on the other side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in like manner a Levite also, when he came to the place, and saw him, passed by on the other side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But a certain Samaritan, as he journeyed, came where he was: and when he saw him, he was moved with compassion,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and came to him, and bound up his wounds, pouring on them oil and wine; and he set him on his own beast, and brought him to an inn, and took care of him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And on the morrow he took out two shillings, and gave them to the host, and said, Take care of him; and whatsoever thou spendest more, I, when I come back again, will repay thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Which of these three, thinkest thou, proved neighbor unto him that fell among the robbers?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, He that showed mercy on him. And Jesus said unto him, Go, and do thou likewise.
verses.speaker: Narrator
