verses.text: Now as they went on their way, he entered into a certain village: and a certain woman named Martha received him into her house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And she had a sister called Mary, who also sat at the Lord’s feet, and heard his word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Martha was cumbered about much serving; and she came up to him, and said, Lord, dost thou not care that my sister did leave me to serve alone? bid her therefore that she help me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Lord answered and said unto her, Martha, Martha, thou art anxious and troubled about many things:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but one thing is needful: for Mary hath chosen the good part, which shall not be taken away from her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass, as he was praying in a certain place, that when he ceased, one of his disciples said unto him, Lord, teach us to pray, even as John also taught his disciples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto them, When ye pray, say, Father, Hallowed be thy name. Thy kingdom come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Give us day by day our daily bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And forgive us our sins; for we ourselves also forgive every one that is indebted to us. And bring us not into temptation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto them, Which of you shall have a friend, and shall go unto him at midnight, and say to him, Friend, lend me three loaves;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for a friend of mine is come to me from a journey, and I have nothing to set before him;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he from within shall answer and say, Trouble me not: the door is now shut, and my children are with me in bed; I cannot rise and give thee?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I say unto you, Though he will not rise and give him because he is his friend, yet because of his importunity he will arise and give him as many as he needeth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I say unto you, Ask, and it shall be given you; seek, and ye shall find; knock, and it shall be opened unto you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For every one that asketh receiveth; and he that seeketh findeth; and to him that knocketh it shall be opened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And of which of you that is a father shall his son ask a loaf, and he give him a stone? or a fish, and he for a fish give him a serpent?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or if he shall ask an egg, will he give him a scorpion?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If ye then, being evil, know how to give good gifts unto your children, how much more shall your heavenly Father give the Holy Spirit to them that ask him?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he was casting out a demon that was dumb. And it came to pass, when the demon was gone out, the dumb man spake; and the multitudes marvelled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But some of them said, By Beelzebub the prince of the demons casteth he out demons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And others, trying him, sought of him a sign from heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he, knowing their thoughts, said unto them, Every kingdom divided against itself is brought to desolation; and a house divided against a house falleth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if Satan also is divided against himself, how shall his kingdom stand? because ye say that I cast out demons by Beelzebub.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if I by Beelzebub cast out demons, by whom do your sons cast them out? therefore shall they be your judges.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if I by the finger of God cast out demons, then is the kingdom of God come upon you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the strong man fully armed guardeth his own court, his goods are in peace:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but when a stronger than he shall come upon him, and overcome him, he taketh from him his whole armor wherein he trusted, and divideth his spoils.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that is not with me is against me; and he that gathereth not with me scattereth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The unclean spirit when he is gone out of the man, passeth through waterless places, seeking rest, and finding none, he saith, I will turn back unto my house whence I came out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he is come, he findeth it swept and garnished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then goeth he, and taketh to him seven other spirits more evil than himself; and they enter in and dwell there: and the last state of that man becometh worse than the first.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass, as he said these things, a certain woman out of the multitude lifted up her voice, and said unto him, Blessed is the womb that bare thee, and the breasts which thou didst suck.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he said, Yea rather, blessed are they that hear the word of God, and keep it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the multitudes were gathering together unto him, he began to say, This generation is an evil generation: it seeketh after a sign; and there shall no sign be given to it but the sign of Jonah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For even as Jonah became a sign unto the Ninevites, so shall also the Son of man be to this generation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The queen of the south shall rise up in the judgment with the men of this generation, and shall condemn them: for she came from the ends of the earth to hear the wisdom of Solomon; and behold, a greater than Solomon is here.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The men of Nineveh shall stand up in the judgment with this generation, and shall condemn it: for they repented at the preaching of Jonah; and behold, a greater than Jonah is here.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No man, when he hath lighted a lamp, putteth it in a cellar, neither under the bushel, but on the stand, that they which enter in may see the light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The lamp of thy body is thine eye: when thine eye is single, thy whole body also is full of light; but when it is evil, thy body also is full of darkness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Look therefore whether the light that is in thee be not darkness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If therefore thy whole body be full of light, having no part dark, it shall be wholly full of light, as when the lamp with its bright shining doth give thee light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now as he spake, a Pharisee asketh him to dine with him: and he went in, and sat down to meat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the Pharisee saw it, he marvelled that he had not first bathed himself before dinner.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said unto him, Now ye the Pharisees cleanse the outside of the cup and of the platter; but your inward part is full of extortion and wickedness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ye foolish ones, did not he that made the outside make the inside also?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But give for alms those things which are within; and behold, all things are clean unto you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But woe unto you Pharisees! for ye tithe mint and rue and every herb, and pass over justice and the love of God: but these ought ye to have done, and not to leave the other undone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Woe unto you Pharisees! for ye love the chief seats in the synagogues, and the salutations in the marketplaces.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Woe unto you! for ye are as the tombs which appear not, and the men that walk over them know it not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And one of the lawyers answering saith unto him, Teacher, in saying this thou reproachest us also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, Woe unto you lawyers also! for ye load men with burdens grievous to be borne, and ye yourselves touch not the burdens with one of your fingers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Woe unto you! for ye build the tombs of the prophets, and your fathers killed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So ye are witnesses and consent unto the works of your fathers: for they killed them, and ye build their tombs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore also said the wisdom of God, I will send unto them prophets and apostles; and some of them they shall kill and persecute;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that the blood of all the prophets, which was shed from the foundation of the world, may be required of this generation;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from the blood of Abel unto the blood of Zachariah, who perished between the altar and the sanctuary: yea, I say unto you, it shall be required of this generation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Woe unto you lawyers! for ye took away the key of knowledge: ye entered not in yourselves, and them that were entering in ye hindered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he was come out from thence, the scribes and the Pharisees began to press upon him vehemently, and to provoke him to speak of many things;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: laying wait for him, to catch something out of his mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the mean time, when the many thousands of the multitude were gathered together, insomuch that they trod one upon another, he began to say unto his disciples first of all, Beware ye of the leaven of the Pharisees, which is hypocrisy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But there is nothing covered up, that shall not be revealed; and hid, that shall not be known.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wherefore whatsoever ye have said in the darkness shall be heard in the light; and what ye have spoken in the ear in the inner chambers shall be proclaimed upon the housetops.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I say unto you my friends, Be not afraid of them that kill the body, and after that have no more that they can do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I will warn you whom ye shall fear: Fear him, who after he hath killed hath power to cast into hell; yea, I say unto you, Fear him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Are not five sparrows sold for two pence? and not one of them is forgotten in the sight of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the very hairs of your head are all numbered. Fear not: ye are of more value than many sparrows.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I say unto you, Every one who shall confess me before men, him shall the Son of man also confess before the angels of God:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but he that denieth me in the presence of men shall be denied in the presence of the angels of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And every one who shall speak a word against the Son of man, it shall be forgiven him: but unto him that blasphemeth against the Holy Spirit it shall not be forgiven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they bring you before the synagogues, and the rulers, and the authorities, be not anxious how or what ye shall answer, or what ye shall say:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for the Holy Spirit shall teach you in that very hour what ye ought to say.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And one out of the multitude said unto him, Teacher, bid my brother divide the inheritance with me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he said unto him, Man, who made me a judge or a divider over you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto them, Take heed, and keep yourselves from all covetousness: for a man’s life consisteth not in the abundance of the things which he possesseth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he spake a parable unto them, saying, The ground of a certain rich man brought forth plentifully:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he reasoned within himself, saying, What shall I do, because I have not where to bestow my fruits?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, This will I do: I will pull down my barns, and build greater; and there will I bestow all my grain and my goods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will say to my soul, Soul, thou hast much goods laid up for many years; take thine ease, eat, drink, be merry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But God said unto him, Thou foolish one, this night is thy soul required of thee; and the things which thou hast prepared, whose shall they be?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So is he that layeth up treasure for himself, and is not rich toward God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto his disciples, Therefore I say unto you, Be not anxious for your life, what ye shall eat; nor yet for your body, what ye shall put on.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the life is more than the food, and the body than the raiment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Consider the ravens, that they sow not, neither reap; which have no store-chamber nor barn; and God feedeth them: of how much more value are ye than the birds!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And which of you by being anxious can add a cubit unto the measure of his life?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If then ye are not able to do even that which is least, why are ye anxious concerning the rest?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Consider the lilies, how they grow: they toil not, neither do they spin; yet I say unto you, Even Solomon in all his glory was not arrayed like one of these.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if God doth so clothe the grass in the field, which to-day is, and to-morrow is cast into the oven; how much more shall he clothe you, O ye of little faith?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And seek not ye what ye shall eat, and what ye shall drink, neither be ye of doubtful mind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For all these things do the nations of the world seek after: but your Father knoweth that ye have need of these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet seek ye his kingdom, and these things shall be added unto you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Fear not, little flock; for it is your Father’s good pleasure to give you the kingdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Sell that which ye have, and give alms; make for yourselves purses which wax not old, a treasure in the heavens that faileth not, where no thief draweth near, neither moth destroyeth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For where your treasure is, there will your heart be also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let your loins be girded about, and your lamps burning;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and be ye yourselves like unto men looking for their lord, when he shall return from the marriage feast; that, when he cometh and knocketh, they may straightway open unto him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Blessed are those servants, whom the lord when he cometh shall find watching: verily I say unto you, that he shall gird himself, and make them sit down to meat, and shall come and serve them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if he shall come in the second watch, and if in the third, and find them so, blessed are those servants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But know this, that if the master of the house had known in what hour the thief was coming, he would have watched, and not have left his house to be broken through.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be ye also ready: for in an hour that ye think not the Son of man cometh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Peter said, Lord, speakest thou this parable unto us, or even unto all?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said, Who then is the faithful and wise steward, whom his lord shall set over his household, to give them their portion of food in due season?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Blessed is that servant, whom his lord when he cometh shall find so doing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of a truth I say unto you, that he will set him over all that he hath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if that servant shall say in his heart, My lord delayeth his coming; and shall begin to beat the menservants and the maidservants, and to eat and drink, and to be drunken;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the lord of that servant shall come in a day when he expecteth not, and in an hour when he knoweth not, and shall cut him asunder, and appoint his portion with the unfaithful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And that servant, who knew his lord’s will, and made not ready, nor did according to his will, shall be beaten with many stripes;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but he that knew not, and did things worthy of stripes, shall be beaten with few stripes. And to whomsoever much is given, of him shall much be required: and to whom they commit much, of him will they ask the more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I came to cast fire upon the earth; and what do I desire, if it is already kindled?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I have a baptism to be baptized with; and how am I straitened till it be accomplished!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Think ye that I am come to give peace in the earth? I tell you, Nay; but rather division:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for there shall be from henceforth five in one house divided, three against two, and two against three.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They shall be divided, father against son, and son against father; mother against daughter, and daughter against her mother; mother in law against her daughter in law, and daughter in law against her mother in law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to the multitudes also, When ye see a cloud rising in the west, straightway ye say, There cometh a shower; and so it cometh to pass.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when ye see a south wind blowing, ye say, There will be a scorching heat; and it cometh to pass.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ye hypocrites, ye know how to interpret the face of the earth and the heaven; but how is it that ye know not how to interpret this time?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And why even of yourselves judge ye not what is right?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For as thou art going with thine adversary before the magistrate, on the way give diligence to be quit of him; lest haply he drag thee unto the judge, and the judge shall deliver thee to the officer, and the officer shall cast thee into prison.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I say unto thee, Thou shalt by no means come out thence, till thou have paid the very last mite.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now there were some present at that very season who told him of the Galilaeans, whose blood Pilate had mingled with their sacrifices.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he answered and said unto them, Think ye that these Galilaeans were sinners above all the Galilaeans, because they have suffered these things?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you, Nay: but, except ye repent, ye shall all in like manner perish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or those eighteen, upon whom the tower in Siloam fell, and killed them, think ye that they were offenders above all the men that dwell in Jerusalem?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you, Nay: but, except ye repent, ye shall all likewise perish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he spake this parable; A certain man had a fig tree planted in his vineyard; and he came seeking fruit thereon, and found none.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto the vinedresser, Behold, these three years I come seeking fruit on this fig tree, and find none: cut it down; why doth it also cumber the ground?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he answering saith unto him, Lord, let it alone this year also, till I shall dig about it, and dung it:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and if it bear fruit thenceforth, well; but if not, thou shalt cut it down.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he was teaching in one of the synagogues on the sabbath day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, a woman that had a spirit of infirmity eighteen years; and she was bowed together, and could in no wise lift herself up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Jesus saw her, he called her, and said to her, Woman, thou art loosed from thine infirmity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he laid his hands upon her: and immediately she was made straight, and glorified God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the ruler of the synagogue, being moved with indignation because Jesus had healed on the sabbath, answered and said to the multitude, There are six days in which men ought to work: in them therefore come and be healed, and not on the day of the sabbath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Lord answered him, and said, Ye hypocrites, doth not each one of you on the sabbath loose his ox or his ass from the stall, and lead him away to watering?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And ought not this woman, being a daughter of Abraham, whom Satan had bound, lo, these eighteen years, to have been loosed from this bond on the day of the sabbath?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as he said these things, all his adversaries were put to shame: and all the multitude rejoiced for all the glorious things that were done by him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said therefore, Unto what is the kingdom of God like? and whereunto shall I liken it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is like unto a grain of mustard seed, which a man took, and cast into his own garden; and it grew, and became a tree; and the birds of the heaven lodged in the branches thereof.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And again he said, Whereunto shall I liken the kingdom of God?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is like unto leaven, which a woman took and hid in three measures of meal, till it was all leavened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he went on his way through cities and villages, teaching, and journeying on unto Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And one said unto him, Lord, are they few that are saved? And he said unto them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Strive to enter in by the narrow door: for many, I say unto you, shall seek to enter in, and shall not be able.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When once the master of the house is risen up, and hath shut to the door, and ye begin to stand without, and to knock at the door, saying, Lord, open to us; and he shall answer and say to you, I know you not whence ye are;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then shall ye begin to say, We did eat and drink in thy presence, and thou didst teach in our streets;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he shall say, I tell you, I know not whence ye are; depart from me, all ye workers of iniquity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There shall be the weeping and the gnashing of teeth, when ye shall see Abraham, and Isaac, and Jacob, and all the prophets, in the kingdom of God, and yourselves cast forth without.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they shall come from the east and west, and from the north and south, and shall sit down in the kingdom of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, there are last who shall be first, and there are first who shall be last.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In that very hour there came certain Pharisees, saying to him, Get thee out, and go hence: for Herod would fain kill thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto them, Go and say to that fox, Behold, I cast out demons and perform cures to-day and to-morrow, and the third day I am perfected.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nevertheless I must go on my way to-day and to-morrow and the day following: for it cannot be that a prophet perish out of Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: O Jerusalem, Jerusalem, that killeth the prophets, and stoneth them that are sent unto her! how often would I have gathered thy children together, even as a hen gathereth her own brood under her wings, and ye would not!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, your house is left unto you desolate: and I say unto you, Ye shall not see me, until ye shall say, Blessed is he that cometh in the name of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass, when he went into the house of one of the rulers of the Pharisees on a sabbath to eat bread, that they were watching him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, there was before him a certain man that had the dropsy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus answering spake unto the lawyers and Pharisees, saying, Is it lawful to heal on the sabbath, or not?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they held their peace. And he took him, and healed him, and let him go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto them, Which of you shall have an ass or an ox fallen into a well, and will not straightway draw him up on a sabbath day?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they could not answer again unto these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he spake a parable unto those that were bidden, when he marked how they chose out the chief seats; saying unto them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When thou art bidden of any man to a marriage feast, sit not down in the chief seat; lest haply a more honorable man than thou be bidden of him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he that bade thee and him shall come and say to thee, Give this man place; and then thou shalt begin with shame to take the lowest place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when thou art bidden, go and sit down in the lowest place; that when he that hath bidden thee cometh, he may say to thee, Friend, go up higher: then shalt thou have glory in the presence of all that sit at meat with thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For every one that exalteth himself shall be humbled; and he that humbleth himself shall be exalted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to him also that had bidden him, When thou makest a dinner or a supper, call not thy friends, nor thy brethren, nor thy kinsmen, nor rich neighbors; lest haply they also bid thee again, and a recompense be made thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when thou makest a feast, bid the poor, the maimed, the lame, the blind:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and thou shalt be blessed; because they have not wherewith to recompense thee: for thou shalt be recompensed in the resurrection of the just.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when one of them that sat at meat with him heard these things, he said unto him, Blessed is he that shall eat bread in the kingdom of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he said unto him, A certain man made a great supper; and he bade many:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he sent forth his servant at supper time to say to them that were bidden, Come; for all things are now ready.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they all with one consent began to make excuse. The first said unto him, I have bought a field, and I must needs go out and see it; I pray thee have me excused.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And another said, I have bought five yoke of oxen, and I go to prove them; I pray thee have me excused.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And another said, I have married a wife, and therefore I cannot come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the servant came, and told his lord these things. Then the master of the house being angry said to his servant, Go out quickly into the streets and lanes of the city, and bring in hither the poor and maimed and blind and lame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the servant said, Lord, what thou didst command is done, and yet there is room.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the lord said unto the servant, Go out into the highways and hedges, and constrain them to come in, that my house may be filled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I say unto you, that none of those men that were bidden shall taste of my supper.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now there went with him great multitudes: and he turned, and said unto them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If any man cometh unto me, and hateth not his own father, and mother, and wife, and children, and brethren, and sisters, yea, and his own life also, he cannot be my disciple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whosoever doth not bear his own cross, and come after me, cannot be my disciple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For which of you, desiring to build a tower, doth not first sit down and count the cost, whether he have wherewith to complete it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Lest haply, when he hath laid a foundation, and is not able to finish, all that behold begin to mock him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, This man began to build, and was not able to finish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or what king, as he goeth to encounter another king in war, will not sit down first and take counsel whether he is able with ten thousand to meet him that cometh against him with twenty thousand?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or else, while the other is yet a great way off, he sendeth an ambassage, and asketh conditions of peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So therefore whosoever he be of you that renounceth not all that he hath, he cannot be my disciple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Salt therefore is good: but if even the salt have lost its savor, wherewith shall it be seasoned?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is fit neither for the land nor for the dunghill: men cast it out. He that hath ears to hear, let him hear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now all the publicans and sinners were drawing near unto him to hear him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And both the Pharisees and the scribes murmured, saying, This man receiveth sinners, and eateth with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he spake unto them this parable, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What man of you, having a hundred sheep, and having lost one of them, doth not leave the ninety and nine in the wilderness, and go after that which is lost, until he find it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he hath found it, he layeth it on his shoulders, rejoicing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he cometh home, he calleth together his friends and his neighbors, saying unto them, Rejoice with me, for I have found my sheep which was lost.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I say unto you, that even so there shall be joy in heaven over one sinner that repenteth, more than over ninety and nine righteous persons, who need no repentance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or what woman having ten pieces of silver, if she lose one piece, doth not light a lamp, and sweep the house, and seek diligently until she find it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when she hath found it, she calleth together her friends and neighbors, saying, Rejoice with me, for I have found the piece which I had lost.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even so, I say unto you, there is joy in the presence of the angels of God over one sinner that repenteth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, A certain man had two sons:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the younger of them said to his father, Father, give me the portion of thy substance that falleth to me. And he divided unto them his living.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And not many days after, the younger son gathered all together and took his journey into a far country; and there he wasted his substance with riotous living.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he had spent all, there arose a mighty famine in that country; and he began to be in want.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he went and joined himself to one of the citizens of that country; and he sent him into his fields to feed swine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he would fain have filled his belly with the husks that the swine did eat: and no man gave unto him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when he came to himself he said, How many hired servants of my father’s have bread enough and to spare, and I perish here with hunger!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will arise and go to my father, and will say unto him, Father, I have sinned against heaven, and in thy sight:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am no more worthy to be called thy son: make me as one of thy hired servants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he arose, and came to his father. But while he was yet afar off, his father saw him, and was moved with compassion, and ran, and fell on his neck, and kissed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the son said unto him, Father, I have sinned against heaven, and in thy sight: I am no more worthy to be called thy son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the father said to his servants, Bring forth quickly the best robe, and put it on him; and put a ring on his hand, and shoes on his feet:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and bring the fatted calf, and kill it, and let us eat, and make merry:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for this my son was dead, and is alive again; he was lost, and is found. And they began to be merry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now his elder son was in the field: and as he came and drew nigh to the house, he heard music and dancing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he called to him one of the servants, and inquired what these things might be.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto him, Thy brother is come; and thy father hath killed the fatted calf, because he hath received him safe and sound.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he was angry, and would not go in: and his father came out, and entreated him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he answered and said to his father, Lo, these many years do I serve thee, and I never transgressed a commandment of thine; and yet thou never gavest me a kid, that I might make merry with my friends:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but when this thy son came, who hath devoured thy living with harlots, thou killedst for him the fatted calf.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto him, Son, thou art ever with me, and all that is mine is thine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But it was meet to make merry and be glad: for this thy brother was dead, and is alive again; and was lost, and is found.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said also unto the disciples, There was a certain rich man, who had a steward; and the same was accused unto him that he was wasting his goods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he called him, and said unto him, What is this that I hear of thee? render the account of thy stewardship; for thou canst be no longer steward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the steward said within himself, What shall I do, seeing that my lord taketh away the stewardship from me? I have not strength to dig; to beg I am ashamed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am resolved what to do, that, when I am put out of the stewardship, they may receive me into their houses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And calling to him each one of his lord’s debtors, he said to the first, How much owest thou unto my lord?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, A hundred measures of oil. And he said unto him, Take thy bond, and sit down quickly and write fifty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said he to another, And how much owest thou? And he said, A hundred measures of wheat. He saith unto him, Take thy bond, and write fourscore.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And his lord commended the unrighteous steward because he had done wisely: for the sons of this world are for their own generation wiser than the sons of the light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I say unto you, Make to yourselves friends by means of the mammon of unrighteousness; that, when it shall fail, they may receive you into the eternal tabernacles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that is faithful in a very little is faithful also in much: and he that is unrighteous in a very little is unrighteous also in much.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If therefore ye have not been faithful in the unrighteous mammon, who will commit to your trust the true riches?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if ye have not been faithful in that which is another’s, who will give you that which is your own?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No servant can serve two masters: for either he will hate the one, and love the other; or else he will hold to one, and despise the other. Ye cannot serve God and mammon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Pharisees, who were lovers of money, heard all these things; and they scoffed at him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto them, Ye are they that justify yourselves in the sight of men; but God knoweth your hearts: for that which is exalted among men is an abomination in the sight of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The law and the prophets were until John: from that time the gospel of the kingdom of God is preached, and every man entereth violently into it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But it is easier for heaven and earth to pass away, than for one tittle of the law to fall.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every one that putteth away his wife, and marrieth another, committeth adultery: and he that marrieth one that is put away from a husband committeth adultery.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now there was a certain rich man, and he was clothed in purple and fine linen, faring sumptuously every day:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and a certain beggar named Lazarus was laid at his gate, full of sores,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and desiring to be fed with the crumbs that fell from the rich man’s table; yea, even the dogs came and licked his sores.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass, that the beggar died, and that he was carried away by the angels into Abraham’s bosom: and the rich man also died, and was buried.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in Hades he lifted up his eyes, being in torments, and seeth Abraham afar off, and Lazarus in his bosom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he cried and said, Father Abraham, have mercy on me, and send Lazarus, that he may dip the tip of his finger in water, and cool my tongue; for I am in anguish in this flame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Abraham said, Son, remember that thou in thy lifetime receivedst thy good things, and Lazarus in like manner evil things: but now here he is comforted, and thou art in anguish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And besides all this, between us and you there is a great gulf fixed, that they that would pass from hence to you may not be able, and that none may cross over from thence to us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, I pray thee therefore, father, that thou wouldest send him to my father’s house;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for I have five brethren; that he may testify unto them, lest they also come into this place of torment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Abraham saith, They have Moses and the prophets; let them hear them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, Nay, father Abraham: but if one go to them from the dead, they will repent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto him, If they hear not Moses and the prophets, neither will they be persuaded, if one rise from the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto his disciples, It is impossible but that occasions of stumbling should come; but woe unto him, through whom they come!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It were well for him if a millstone were hanged about his neck, and he were thrown into the sea, rather than that he should cause one of these little ones to stumble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take heed to yourselves: if thy brother sin, rebuke him; and if he repent, forgive him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if he sin against thee seven times in the day, and seven times turn again to thee, saying, I repent; thou shalt forgive him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the apostles said unto the Lord, Increase our faith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said, If ye had faith as a grain of mustard seed, ye would say unto this sycamine tree, Be thou rooted up, and be thou planted in the sea; and it would obey you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But who is there of you, having a servant plowing or keeping sheep, that will say unto him, when he is come in from the field, Come straightway and sit down to meat;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and will not rather say unto him, Make ready wherewith I may sup, and gird thyself, and serve me, till I have eaten and drunken; and afterward thou shalt eat and drink?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Doth he thank the servant because he did the things that were commanded?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even so ye also, when ye shall have done all the things that are commanded you, say, We are unprofitable servants; we have done that which it was our duty to do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass, as they were on the way to Jerusalem, that he was passing along the borders of Samaria and Galilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as he entered into a certain village, there met him ten men that were lepers, who stood afar off:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they lifted up their voices, saying, Jesus, Master, have mercy on us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he saw them, he said unto them, Go and show yourselves unto the priests. And it came to pass, as they went, they were cleansed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And one of them, when he saw that he was healed, turned back, with a loud voice glorifying God;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he fell upon his face at his feet, giving him thanks: and he was a Samaritan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus answering said, Were not the ten cleansed? but where are the nine?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Were there none found that returned to give glory to God, save this stranger?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto him, Arise, and go thy way: thy faith hath made thee whole.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And being asked by the Pharisees, when the kingdom of God cometh, he answered them and said, The kingdom of God cometh not with observation:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: neither shall they say, Lo, here! or, There! for lo, the kingdom of God is within you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto the disciples, The days will come, when ye shall desire to see one of the days of the Son of man, and ye shall not see it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they shall say to you, Lo, there! Lo, here! go not away, nor follow after them:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for as the lightning, when it lighteneth out of the one part under the heaven, shineth unto the other part under heaven; so shall the Son of man be in his day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But first must he suffer many things and be rejected of this generation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as it came to pass in the days of Noah, even so shall it be also in the days of the Son of man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They ate, they drank, they married, they were given in marriage, until the day that Noah entered into the ark, and the flood came, and destroyed them all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Likewise even as it came to pass in the days of Lot; they ate, they drank, they bought, they sold, they planted, they builded;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but in the day that Lot went out from Sodom it rained fire and brimstone from heaven, and destroyed them all:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: after the same manner shall it be in the day that the Son of man is revealed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In that day, he that shall be on the housetop, and his goods in the house, let him not go down to take them away: and let him that is in the field likewise not return back.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remember Lot’s wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whosoever shall seek to gain his life shall lose it: but whosoever shall lose his life shall preserve it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I say unto you, In that night there shall be two men on one bed; the one shall be taken, and the other shall be left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There shall be two women grinding together; the one shall be taken, and the other shall be left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they answering say unto him, Where, Lord? And he said unto them, Where the body is, thither will the eagles also be gathered together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he spake a parable unto them to the end that they ought always to pray, and not to faint;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, There was in a city a judge, who feared not God, and regarded not man:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and there was a widow in that city; and she came oft unto him, saying, Avenge me of mine adversary.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he would not for a while: but afterward he said within himself, Though I fear not God, nor regard man;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: yet because this widow troubleth me, I will avenge her, lest she wear me out by her continual coming.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said, Hear what the unrighteous judge saith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And shall not God avenge his elect, that cry to him day and night, and yet he is longsuffering over them?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I say unto you, that he will avenge them speedily. Nevertheless, when the Son of man cometh, shall he find faith on the earth?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he spake also this parable unto certain who trusted in themselves that they were righteous, and set all others at nought:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Two men went up into the temple to pray; the one a Pharisee, and the other a publican.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Pharisee stood and prayed thus with himself, God, I thank thee, that I am not as the rest of men, extortioners, unjust, adulterers, or even as this publican.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I fast twice in the week; I give tithes of all that I get.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the publican, standing afar off, would not lift up so much as his eyes unto heaven, but smote his breast, saying, God, be thou merciful to me a sinner.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I say unto you, This man went down to his house justified rather than the other: for every one that exalteth himself shall be humbled; but he that humbleth himself shall be exalted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they were bringing unto him also their babes, that he should touch them: but when the disciples saw it, they rebuked them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus called them unto him, saying, Suffer the little children to come unto me, and forbid them not: for to such belongeth the kingdom of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Verily I say unto you, Whosoever shall not receive the kingdom of God as a little child, he shall in no wise enter therein.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a certain ruler asked him, saying, Good Teacher, what shall I do to inherit eternal life?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus said unto him, Why callest thou me good? none is good, save one, even God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou knowest the commandments, Do not commit adultery, Do not kill, Do not steal, Do not bear false witness, Honor thy father and mother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, All these things have I observed from my youth up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Jesus heard it, he said unto him, One thing thou lackest yet: sell all that thou hast, and distribute unto the poor, and thou shalt have treasure in heaven: and come, follow me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when he heard these things, he became exceeding sorrowful; for he was very rich.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus seeing him said, How hardly shall they that have riches enter into the kingdom of God!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For it is easier for a camel to enter in through a needle’s eye, than for a rich man to enter into the kingdom of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they that heard it said, Then who can be saved?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he said, The things which are impossible with men are possible with God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Peter said, Lo, we have left our own, and followed thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto them, Verily I say unto you, There is no man that hath left house, or wife, or brethren, or parents, or children, for the kingdom of God’s sake,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who shall not receive manifold more in this time, and in the world to come eternal life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he took unto him the twelve, and said unto them, Behold, we go up to Jerusalem, and all the things that are written through the prophets shall be accomplished unto the Son of man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he shall be delivered up unto the Gentiles, and shall be mocked, and shamefully treated, and spit upon:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they shall scourge and kill him: and the third day he shall rise again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they understood none of these things; and this saying was hid from them, and they perceived not the things that were said.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass, as he drew nigh unto Jericho, a certain blind man sat by the way side begging:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and hearing a multitude going by, he inquired what this meant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they told him, that Jesus of Nazareth passeth by.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he cried, saying, Jesus, thou son of David, have mercy on me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they that went before rebuked him, that he should hold his peace: but he cried out the more a great deal, Thou son of David, have mercy on me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus stood, and commanded him to be brought unto him: and when he was come near, he asked him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What wilt thou that I should do unto thee? And he said, Lord, that I may receive my sight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus said unto him, Receive thy sight: thy faith hath made thee whole.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And immediately he received his sight, and followed him, glorifying God: and all the people, when they saw it, gave praise unto God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he entered and was passing through Jericho.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, a man called by name Zacchaeus; and he was a chief publican, and he was rich.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he sought to see Jesus who he was; and could not for the crowd, because he was little of stature.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he ran on before, and climbed up into a sycomore tree to see him: for he was to pass that way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Jesus came to the place, he looked up, and said unto him, Zacchaeus, make haste, and come down; for to-day I must abide at thy house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he made haste, and came down, and received him joyfully.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they saw it, they all murmured, saying, He is gone in to lodge with a man that is a sinner.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Zacchaeus stood, and said unto the Lord, Behold, Lord, the half of my goods I give to the poor; and if I have wrongfully exacted aught of any man, I restore fourfold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus said unto him, To-day is salvation come to this house, forasmuch as he also is a son of Abraham.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Son of man came to seek and to save that which was lost.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as they heard these things, he added and spake a parable, because he was nigh to Jerusalem, and because they supposed that the kingdom of God was immediately to appear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said therefore, A certain nobleman went into a far country, to receive for himself a kingdom, and to return.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he called ten servants of his, and gave them ten pounds, and said unto them, Trade ye herewith till I come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But his citizens hated him, and sent an ambassage after him, saying, We will not that this man reign over us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass, when he was come back again, having received the kingdom, that he commanded these servants, unto whom he had given the money, to be called to him, that he might know what they had gained by trading.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the first came before him, saying, Lord, thy pound hath made ten pounds more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto him, Well done, thou good servant: because thou wast found faithful in a very little, have thou authority over ten cities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the second came, saying, Thy pound, Lord, hath made five pounds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto him also, Be thou also over five cities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And another came, saying, Lord, behold, here is thy pound, which I kept laid up in a napkin:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for I feared thee, because thou art an austere man: thou takest up that which thou layedst not down, and reapest that which thou didst not sow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He saith unto him, Out of thine own mouth will I judge thee, thou wicked servant. Thou knewest that I am an austere man, taking up that which I laid not down, and reaping that which I did not sow;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then wherefore gavest thou not my money into the bank, and I at my coming should have required it with interest?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto them that stood by, Take away from him the pound, and give it unto him that hath the ten pounds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said unto him, Lord, he hath ten pounds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I say unto you, that unto every one that hath shall be given; but from him that hath not, even that which he hath shall be taken away from him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But these mine enemies, that would not that I should reign over them, bring hither, and slay them before me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he had thus spoken, he went on before, going up to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass, when he drew nigh unto Bethphage and Bethany, at the mount that is called Olivet, he sent two of the disciples,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, Go your way into the village over against you; in which as ye enter ye shall find a colt tied, whereon no man ever yet sat: loose him, and bring him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if any one ask you, Why do ye loose him? thus shall ye say, The Lord hath need of him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they that were sent went away, and found even as he had said unto them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as they were loosing the colt, the owners thereof said unto them, Why loose ye the colt?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said, The Lord hath need of him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they brought him to Jesus: and they threw their garments upon the colt, and set Jesus thereon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as he went, they spread their garments in the way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as he was now drawing nigh, even at the descent of the mount of Olives, the whole multitude of the disciples began to rejoice and praise God with a loud voice for all the mighty works which they had seen;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, Blessed is the King that cometh in the name of the Lord: peace in heaven, and glory in the highest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And some of the Pharisees from the multitude said unto him, Teacher, rebuke thy disciples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he answered and said, I tell you that, if these shall hold their peace, the stones will cry out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he drew nigh, he saw the city and wept over it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, If thou hadst known in this day, even thou, the things which belong unto peace! but now they are hid from thine eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the days shall come upon thee, when thine enemies shall cast up a bank about thee, and compass thee round, and keep thee in on every side,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and shall dash thee to the ground, and thy children within thee; and they shall not leave in thee one stone upon another; because thou knewest not the time of thy visitation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he entered into the temple, and began to cast out them that sold,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying unto them, It is written, And my house shall be a house of prayer: but ye have made it a den of robbers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he was teaching daily in the temple. But the chief priests and the scribes and the principal men of the people sought to destroy him:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they could not find what they might do; for the people all hung upon him, listening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass, on one of the days, as he was teaching the people in the temple, and preaching the gospel, there came upon him the chief priests and the scribes with the elders;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they spake, saying unto him, Tell us: By what authority doest thou these things? or who is he that gave thee this authority?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he answered and said unto them, I also will ask you a question; and tell me:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The baptism of John, was it from heaven, or from men?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they reasoned with themselves, saying, If we shall say, From heaven; he will say, Why did ye not believe him?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if we shall say, From men; all the people will stone us: for they are persuaded that John was a prophet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they answered, that they knew not whence it was.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus said unto them, Neither tell I you by what authority I do these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he began to speak unto the people this parable: A man planted a vineyard, and let it out to husbandmen, and went into another country for a long time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And at the season he sent unto the husbandmen a servant, that they should give him of the fruit of the vineyard: but the husbandmen beat him, and sent him away empty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he sent yet another servant: and him also they beat, and handled him shamefully, and sent him away empty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he sent yet a third: and him also they wounded, and cast him forth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the lord of the vineyard said, What shall I do? I will send my beloved son; it may be they will reverence him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the husbandmen saw him, they reasoned one with another, saying, This is the heir; let us kill him, that the inheritance may be ours.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they cast him forth out of the vineyard, and killed him. What therefore will the lord of the vineyard do unto them?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will come and destroy these husbandmen, and will give the vineyard unto others. And when they heard it, they said, God forbid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But he looked upon them, and said, What then is this that is written,
The stone which the builders rejected,
The same was made the head of the corner?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every one that falleth on that stone shall be broken to pieces; but on whomsoever it shall fall, it will scatter him as dust.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the scribes and the chief priests sought to lay hands on him in that very hour; and they feared the people: for they perceived that he spake this parable against them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they watched him, and sent forth spies, who feigned themselves to be righteous, that they might take hold of his speech, so as to deliver him up to the rule and to the authority of the governor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they asked him, saying, Teacher, we know that thou sayest and teachest rightly, and acceptest not the person of any, but of a truth teachest the way of God:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is it lawful for us to give tribute unto Caesar, or not?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he perceived their craftiness, and said unto them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Show me a denarius. Whose image and superscription hath it? And they said, Caesar’s.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto them, Then render unto Caesar the things that are Caesar’s, and unto God the things that are God’s.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they were not able to take hold of the saying before the people: and they marvelled at his answer, and held their peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there came to him certain of the Sadducees, they that say that there is no resurrection;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they asked him, saying, Teacher, Moses wrote unto us, that if a man’s brother die, having a wife, and he be childless, his brother should take the wife, and raise up seed unto his brother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There were therefore seven brethren: and the first took a wife, and died childless;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the second:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the third took her; and likewise the seven also left no children, and died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Afterward the woman also died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the resurrection therefore whose wife of them shall she be? for the seven had her to wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus said unto them, The sons of this world marry, and are given in marriage:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but they that are accounted worthy to attain to that world, and the resurrection from the dead, neither marry, nor are given in marriage:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for neither can they die any more: for they are equal unto the angels; and are sons of God, being sons of the resurrection.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But that the dead are raised, even Moses showed, in the place concerning the Bush, when he calleth the Lord the God of Abraham, and the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now he is not the God of the dead, but of the living: for all live unto him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And certain of the scribes answering said, Teacher, thou hast well said.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For they durst not any more ask him any question.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto them, How say they that the Christ is David’s son?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For David himself saith in the book of Psalms,
The Lord said unto my Lord,
Sit thou on my right hand,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Till I make thine enemies the footstool of thy feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David therefore calleth him Lord, and how is he his son?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in the hearing of all the people he said unto his disciples,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Beware of the scribes, who desire to walk in long robes, and love salutations in the marketplaces, and chief seats in the synagogues, and chief places at feasts;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who devour widows’ houses, and for a pretence make long prayers: these shall receive greater condemnation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he looked up, and saw the rich men that were casting their gifts into the treasury.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he saw a certain poor widow casting in thither two mites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, Of a truth I say unto you, This poor widow cast in more than they all:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for all these did of their superfluity cast in unto the gifts; but she of her want did cast in all the living that she had.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as some spake of the temple, how it was adorned with goodly stones and offerings, he said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for these things which ye behold, the days will come, in which there shall not be left here one stone upon another, that shall not be thrown down.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they asked him, saying, Teacher, when therefore shall these things be? and what shall be the sign when these things are about to come to pass?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, Take heed that ye be not led astray: for many shall come in my name, saying, I am he; and, The time is at hand: go ye not after them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when ye shall hear of wars and tumults, be not terrified: for these things must needs come to pass first; but the end is not immediately.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said he unto them, Nation shall rise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and there shall be great earthquakes, and in divers places famines and pestilences; and there shall be terrors and great signs from heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But before all these things, they shall lay their hands on you, and shall persecute you, delivering you up to the synagogues and prisons, bringing you before kings and governors for my name’s sake.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It shall turn out unto you for a testimony.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Settle it therefore in your hearts, not to meditate beforehand how to answer:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for I will give you a mouth and wisdom, which all your adversaries shall not be able to withstand or to gainsay.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But ye shall be delivered up even by parents, and brethren, and kinsfolk, and friends; and some of you shall they cause to be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And ye shall be hated of all men for my name’s sake.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And not a hair of your head shall perish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In your patience ye shall win your souls.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when ye see Jerusalem compassed with armies, then know that her desolation is at hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then let them that are in Judaea flee unto the mountains; and let them that are in the midst of her depart out; and let not them that are in the country enter therein.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For these are days of vengeance, that all things which are written may be fulfilled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Woe unto them that are with child and to them that give suck in those days! for there shall be great distress upon the land, and wrath unto this people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they shall fall by the edge of the sword, and shall be led captive into all the nations: and Jerusalem shall be trodden down of the Gentiles, until the times of the Gentiles be fulfilled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there shall be signs in sun and moon and stars; and upon the earth distress of nations, in perplexity for the roaring of the sea and the billows;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: men fainting for fear, and for expectation of the things which are coming on the world: for the powers of the heavens shall be shaken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And then shall they see the Son of man coming in a cloud with power and great glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when these things begin to come to pass, look up, and lift up your heads; because your redemption draweth nigh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he spake to them a parable: Behold the fig tree, and all the trees:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: when they now shoot forth, ye see it and know of your own selves that the summer is now nigh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even so ye also, when ye see these things coming to pass, know ye that the kingdom of God is nigh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Verily I say unto you, This generation shall not pass away, till all things be accomplished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Heaven and earth shall pass away: but my words shall not pass away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But take heed to yourselves, lest haply your hearts be overcharged with surfeiting, and drunkenness, and cares of this life, and that day come on you suddenly as a snare:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for so shall it come upon all them that dwell on the face of all the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But watch ye at every season, making supplication, that ye may prevail to escape all these things that shall come to pass, and to stand before the Son of man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And every day he was teaching in the temple; and every night he went out, and lodged in the mount that is called Olivet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the people came early in the morning to him in the temple, to hear him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the feast of unleavened bread drew nigh, which is called the Passover.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the chief priests and the scribes sought how they might put him to death; for they feared the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Satan entered into Judas who was called Iscariot, being of the number of the twelve.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he went away, and communed with the chief priests and captains, how he might deliver him unto them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they were glad, and covenanted to give him money.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he consented, and sought opportunity to deliver him unto them in the absence of the multitude.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the day of unleavened bread came, on which the passover must be sacrificed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he sent Peter and John, saying, Go and make ready for us the passover, that we may eat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said unto him, Where wilt thou that we make ready?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto them, Behold, when ye are entered into the city, there shall meet you a man bearing a pitcher of water; follow him into the house whereinto he goeth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And ye shall say unto the master of the house, The Teacher saith unto thee, Where is the guest-chamber, where I shall eat the passover with my disciples?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he will show you a large upper room furnished: there make ready.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they went, and found as he had said unto them: and they made ready the passover.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the hour was come, he sat down, and the apostles with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto them, With desire I have desired to eat this passover with you before I suffer:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for I say unto you, I shall not eat it, until it be fulfilled in the kingdom of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he received a cup, and when he had given thanks, he said, Take this, and divide it among yourselves:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for I say unto you, I shall not drink from henceforth of the fruit of the vine, until the kingdom of God shall come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he took bread, and when he had given thanks, he brake it, and gave to them, saying, This is my body which is given for you: this do in remembrance of me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the cup in like manner after supper, saying, This cup is the new covenant in my blood, even that which is poured out for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But behold, the hand of him that betrayeth me is with me on the table.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Son of man indeed goeth, as it hath been determined: but woe unto that man through whom he is betrayed!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they began to question among themselves, which of them it was that should do this thing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there arose also a contention among them, which of them was accounted to be greatest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto them, The kings of the Gentiles have lordship over them; and they that have authority over them are called Benefactors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But ye shall not be so: but he that is the greater among you, let him become as the younger; and he that is chief, as he that doth serve.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For which is greater, he that sitteth at meat, or he that serveth? is not he that sitteth at meat? but I am in the midst of you as he that serveth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But ye are they that have continued with me in my temptations;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and I appoint unto you a kingdom, even as my Father appointed unto me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that ye may eat and drink at my table in my kingdom; and ye shall sit on thrones judging the twelve tribes of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simon, Simon, behold, Satan asked to have you, that he might sift you as wheat:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but I made supplication for thee, that thy faith fail not; and do thou, when once thou hast turned again, establish thy brethren.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto him, Lord, with thee I am ready to go both to prison and to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, I tell thee, Peter, the cock shall not crow this day, until thou shalt thrice deny that thou knowest me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto them, When I sent you forth without purse, and wallet, and shoes, lacked ye anything? And they said, Nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto them, But now, he that hath a purse, let him take it, and likewise a wallet; and he that hath none, let him sell his cloak, and buy a sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I say unto you, that this which is written must be fulfilled in me, And he was reckoned with transgressors: for that which concerneth me hath fulfilment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said, Lord, behold, here are two swords. And he said unto them, It is enough.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he came out, and went, as his custom was, unto the mount of Olives; and the disciples also followed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he was at the place, he said unto them, Pray that ye enter not into temptation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he was parted from them about a stone’s cast; and he kneeled down and prayed,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, Father, if thou be willing, remove this cup from me: nevertheless not my will, but thine, be done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there appeared unto him an angel from heaven, strengthening him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And being in an agony he prayed more earnestly; and his sweat became as it were great drops of blood falling down upon the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he rose up from his prayer, he came unto the disciples, and found them sleeping for sorrow,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said unto them, Why sleep ye? rise and pray, that ye enter not into temptation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While he yet spake, behold, a multitude, and he that was called Judas, one of the twelve, went before them; and he drew near unto Jesus to kiss him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus said unto him, Judas, betrayest thou the Son of man with a kiss?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they that were about him saw what would follow, they said, Lord, shall we smite with the sword?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a certain one of them smote the servant of the high priest, and struck off his right ear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus answered and said, Suffer ye them thus far. And he touched his ear, and healed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus said unto the chief priests, and captains of the temple, and elders, that were come against him, Are ye come out, as against a robber, with swords and staves?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When I was daily with you in the temple, ye stretched not forth your hands against me: but this is your hour, and the power of darkness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they seized him, and led him away, and brought him into the high priest’s house. But Peter followed afar off.
verses.speaker: Narrator
