verses.text: And when they had kindled a fire in the midst of the court, and had sat down together, Peter sat in the midst of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a certain maid seeing him as he sat in the light of the fire, and looking stedfastly upon him, said, This man also was with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he denied, saying, Woman, I know him not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after a little while another saw him, and said, Thou also art one of them. But Peter said, Man, I am not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after the space of about one hour another confidently affirmed, saying, Of a truth this man also was with him; for he is a Galilaean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Peter said, Man, I know not what thou sayest. And immediately, while he yet spake, the cock crew.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord turned, and looked upon Peter. And Peter remembered the word of the Lord, how that he said unto him, Before the cock crow this day thou shalt deny me thrice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he went out, and wept bitterly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the men that held Jesus mocked him, and beat him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they blindfolded him, and asked him, saying, Prophesy: who is he that struck thee?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And many other things spake they against him, reviling him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as soon as it was day, the assembly of the elders of the people was gathered together, both chief priests and scribes; and they led him away into their council, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If thou art the Christ, tell us. But he said unto them, If I tell you, ye will not believe:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and if I ask you, ye will not answer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But from henceforth shall the Son of man be seated at the right hand of the power of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they all said, Art thou then the Son of God? And he said unto them, Ye say that I am.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said, What further need have we of witness? for we ourselves have heard from his own mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the whole company of them rose up, and brought him before Pilate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they began to accuse him, saying, We found this man perverting our nation, and forbidding to give tribute to Caesar, and saying that he himself is Christ a king.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Pilate asked him, saying, Art thou the King of the Jews? And he answered him and said, Thou sayest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Pilate said unto the chief priests and the multitudes, I find no fault in this man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they were the more urgent, saying, He stirreth up the people, teaching throughout all Judaea, and beginning from Galilee even unto this place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when Pilate heard it, he asked whether the man were a Galilaean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he knew that he was of Herod’s jurisdiction, he sent him unto Herod, who himself also was at Jerusalem in these days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when Herod saw Jesus, he was exceeding glad: for he was of a long time desirous to see him, because he had heard concerning him; and he hoped to see some miracle done by him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he questioned him in many words; but he answered him nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the chief priests and the scribes stood, vehemently accusing him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Herod with his soldiers set him at nought, and mocked him, and arraying him in gorgeous apparel sent him back to Pilate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Herod and Pilate became friends with each other that very day: for before they were at enmity between themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Pilate called together the chief priests and the rulers and the people,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said unto them, Ye brought unto me this man, as one that perverteth the people: and behold, I, having examined him before you, found no fault in this man touching those things whereof ye accuse him:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: no, nor yet Herod: for he sent him back unto us; and behold, nothing worthy of death hath been done by him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will therefore chastise him, and release him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they cried out all together, saying, Away with this man, and release unto us Barabbas:—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one who for a certain insurrection made in the city, and for murder, was cast into prison.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Pilate spake unto them again, desiring to release Jesus;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but they shouted, saying, Crucify, crucify him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto them the third time, Why, what evil hath this man done? I have found no cause of death in him: I will therefore chastise him and release him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they were urgent with loud voices, asking that he might be crucified. And their voices prevailed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Pilate gave sentence that what they asked for should be done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he released him that for insurrection and murder had been cast into prison, whom they asked for; but Jesus he delivered up to their will.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they led him away, they laid hold upon one Simon of Cyrene, coming from the country, and laid on him the cross, to bear it after Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there followed him a great multitude of the people, and of women who bewailed and lamented him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus turning unto them said, Daughters of Jerusalem, weep not for me, but weep for yourselves, and for your children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For behold, the days are coming, in which they shall say, Blessed are the barren, and the wombs that never bare, and the breasts that never gave suck.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then shall they begin to say to the mountains, Fall on us; and to the hills, Cover us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if they do these things in the green tree, what shall be done in the dry?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there were also two others, malefactors, led with him to be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they came unto the place which is called The skull, there they crucified him, and the malefactors, one on the right hand and the other on the left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus said, Father, forgive them; for they know not what they do. And parting his garments among them, they cast lots.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the people stood beholding. And the rulers also scoffed at him, saying, He saved others; let him save himself, if this is the Christ of God, his chosen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the soldiers also mocked him, coming to him, offering him vinegar,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and saying, If thou art the King of the Jews, save thyself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there was also a superscription over him, This is the King of the Jews.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And one of the malefactors that were hanged railed on him, saying, Art not thou the Christ? save thyself and us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the other answered, and rebuking him said, Dost thou not even fear God, seeing thou art in the same condemnation?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And we indeed justly; for we receive the due reward of our deeds: but this man hath done nothing amiss.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, Jesus, remember me when thou comest in thy kingdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto him, Verily I say unto thee, To-day shalt thou be with me in Paradise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it was now about the sixth hour, and a darkness came over the whole land until the ninth hour,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the sun’s light failing: and the veil of the temple was rent in the midst.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus, crying with a loud voice, said, Father, into thy hands I commend my spirit: and having said this, he gave up the ghost.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the centurion saw what was done, he glorified God, saying, Certainly this was a righteous man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the multitudes that came together to this sight, when they beheld the things that were done, returned smiting their breasts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all his acquaintance, and the women that followed with him from Galilee, stood afar off, seeing these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, a man named Joseph, who was a councillor, a good and righteous man
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (he had not consented to their counsel and deed), a man of Arimathaea, a city of the Jews, who was looking for the kingdom of God:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: this man went to Pilate, and asked for the body of Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he took it down, and wrapped it in a linen cloth, and laid him in a tomb that was hewn in stone, where never man had yet lain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it was the day of the Preparation, and the sabbath drew on.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the women, who had come with him out of Galilee, followed after, and beheld the tomb, and how his body was laid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And they returned, and prepared spices and ointments.
And on the sabbath they rested according to the commandment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But on the first day of the week, at early dawn, they came unto the tomb, bringing the spices which they had prepared.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they found the stone rolled away from the tomb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they entered in, and found not the body of the Lord Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass, while they were perplexed thereabout, behold, two men stood by them in dazzling apparel:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and as they were affrighted and bowed down their faces to the earth, they said unto them, Why seek ye the living among the dead?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He is not here, but is risen: remember how he spake unto you when he was yet in Galilee,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying that the Son of man must be delivered up into the hands of sinful men, and be crucified, and the third day rise again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they remembered his words,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and returned from the tomb, and told all these things to the eleven, and to all the rest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now they were Mary Magdalene, and Joanna, and Mary the mother of James: and the other women with them told these things unto the apostles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And these words appeared in their sight as idle talk; and they disbelieved them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Peter arose, and ran unto the tomb; and stooping and looking in, he seeth the linen cloths by themselves; and he departed to his home, wondering at that which was come to pass.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, two of them were going that very day to a village named Emmaus, which was threescore furlongs from Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they communed with each other of all these things which had happened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass, while they communed and questioned together, that Jesus himself drew near, and went with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But their eyes were holden that they should not know him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto them, What communications are these that ye have one with another, as ye walk? And they stood still, looking sad.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And one of them, named Cleopas, answering said unto him, Dost thou alone sojourn in Jerusalem and not know the things which are come to pass there in these days?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto them, What things? And they said unto him, The things concerning Jesus the Nazarene, who was a prophet mighty in deed and word before God and all the people:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and how the chief priests and our rulers delivered him up to be condemned to death, and crucified him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But we hoped that it was he who should redeem Israel. Yea and besides all this, it is now the third day since these things came to pass.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover certain women of our company amazed us, having been early at the tomb;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and when they found not his body, they came, saying, that they had also seen a vision of angels, who said that he was alive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And certain of them that were with us went to the tomb, and found it even so as the women had said: but him they saw not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto them, O foolish men, and slow of heart to believe in all that the prophets have spoken!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behooved it not the Christ to suffer these things, and to enter into his glory?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And beginning from Moses and from all the prophets, he interpreted to them in all the scriptures the things concerning himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they drew nigh unto the village, whither they were going: and he made as though he would go further.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they constrained him, saying, Abide with us; for it is toward evening, and the day is now far spent. And he went in to abide with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass, when he had sat down with them to meat, he took the bread and blessed; and breaking it he gave to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And their eyes were opened, and they knew him; and he vanished out of their sight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said one to another, Was not our heart burning within us, while he spake to us in the way, while he opened to us the scriptures?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they rose up that very hour, and returned to Jerusalem, and found the eleven gathered together, and them that were with them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, The Lord is risen indeed, and hath appeared to Simon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they rehearsed the things that happened in the way, and how he was known of them in the breaking of the bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as they spake these things, he himself stood in the midst of them, and saith unto them, Peace be unto you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they were terrified and affrighted, and supposed that they beheld a spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto them, Why are ye troubled? and wherefore do questionings arise in your heart?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: See my hands and my feet, that it is I myself: handle me, and see; for a spirit hath not flesh and bones, as ye behold me having.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he had said this, he showed them his hands and his feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And while they still disbelieved for joy, and wondered, he said unto them, Have ye here anything to eat?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they gave him a piece of a broiled fish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he took it, and ate before them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto them, These are my words which I spake unto you, while I was yet with you, that all things must needs be fulfilled, which are written in the law of Moses, and the prophets, and the psalms, concerning me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then opened he their mind, that they might understand the scriptures;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he said unto them, Thus it is written, that the Christ should suffer, and rise again from the dead the third day;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and that repentance and remission of sins should be preached in his name unto all the nations, beginning from Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ye are witnesses of these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, I send forth the promise of my Father upon you: but tarry ye in the city, until ye be clothed with power from on high.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he led them out until they were over against Bethany: and he lifted up his hands, and blessed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass, while he blessed them, he parted from them, and was carried up into heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they worshipped him, and returned to Jerusalem with great joy:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and were continually in the temple, blessing God.
verses.speaker: Narrator
